org.fishwife.jrugged

Class DefaultFailureInterpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.DefaultFailureInterpreter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FailureInterpreter

    public final class DefaultFailureInterpreter
extends Object
implements FailureInterpreter
    Trips a CircuitBreaker if the number of failures in a given time window exceed a specified tolerance. By default, all Throwable occurrences will be considered failures.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultFailureInterpreter()
      Default constructor.
      DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore)
      Constructor where we specify certain Throwable classes that will be ignored by the breaker and not be treated as failures (they will be passed through transparently without causing the breaker to trip).
      DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore, int limit, long windowMillis)
      Constructor where we specify tolerance and a set of ignored failures.
      DefaultFailureInterpreter(int limit, long windowMillis)
      Constructor that allows a tolerance for a certain number of failures within a given window of time without tripping.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<Class<? extends Throwable>> getIgnore()
      Returns the set of currently ignored Throwable classes.
      int getLimit()
      Returns the current number of failures within the window that will be tolerated without tripping the breaker.
      long getWindowMillis()
      Returns the length of the currently configured tolerance window in milliseconds.
      void setIgnore(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore)
      Specifies an array of Throwable classes to ignore.
      void setLimit(int limit)
      Specifies the number of tolerated failures within the configured time window.
      void setWindowMillis(long windowMillis)
      Specifies the length of the tolerance window in milliseconds.
      boolean shouldTrip(Throwable cause)
      Returns whether the governed CircuitBreaker should trip OPEN as a result of this failure.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultFailureInterpreter

        public DefaultFailureInterpreter()
        Default constructor. Any Throwable will cause the breaker to trip.

      • DefaultFailureInterpreter

        public DefaultFailureInterpreter(int limit,
                                 long windowMillis)
        Constructor that allows a tolerance for a certain number of failures within a given window of time without tripping.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of failures that will be tolerated (i.e. the number of failures has to be strictly greater than this number in order to trip the breaker). For example, if the limit is 3, the fourth failure during the window will cause the breaker to trip.
        windowMillis - length of the window in milliseconds

      • DefaultFailureInterpreter

        public DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore)
        Constructor where we specify certain Throwable classes that will be ignored by the breaker and not be treated as failures (they will be passed through transparently without causing the breaker to trip).
        Parameters:
        ignore - an array of Throwable classes that will be ignored. Any given Throwable that is a subclass of one of these classes will be ignored.

      • DefaultFailureInterpreter

        public DefaultFailureInterpreter(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore,
                                 int limit,
                                 long windowMillis)
        Constructor where we specify tolerance and a set of ignored failures.
        Parameters:
        ignore - an array of Throwable classes that will be ignored. Any given Throwable that is a subclass of one of these classes will be ignored.
        limit - the number of failures that will be tolerated (i.e. the number of failures has to be strictly greater than this number in order to trip the breaker). For example, if the limit is 3, the fourth failure during the window will cause the breaker to trip.
        windowMillis - length of the window in milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • shouldTrip

        public boolean shouldTrip(Throwable cause)
        Description copied from interface: FailureInterpreter
        Returns whether the governed CircuitBreaker should trip OPEN as a result of this failure.
        Specified by:
        shouldTrip in interface FailureInterpreter
        Parameters:
        cause - the Throwable failure that occurred
        Returns:
        boolean true iff the circuit should trip

      • getIgnore

        public Set<Class<? extends Throwable>> getIgnore()
        Returns the set of currently ignored Throwable classes.
        Returns:
        Set

      • setIgnore

        public void setIgnore(Class<? extends Throwable>[] ignore)
        Specifies an array of Throwable classes to ignore. These will not be considered failures.
        Parameters:
        ignore - array of Class objects

      • getLimit

        public int getLimit()
        Returns the current number of failures within the window that will be tolerated without tripping the breaker.
        Returns:
        int

      • setLimit

        public void setLimit(int limit)
        Specifies the number of tolerated failures within the configured time window. If limit is set to n then the (n+1)th failure will trip the breaker. Mutating the limit at runtime can reset previous failure counts.
        Parameters:
        limit - int

      • getWindowMillis

        public long getWindowMillis()
        Returns the length of the currently configured tolerance window in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        long

      • setWindowMillis

        public void setWindowMillis(long windowMillis)
        Specifies the length of the tolerance window in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        windowMillis - long
